result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of paying the Costs and DNA Surcharge, defendant to serve 5 days Huber, concurrent to any other case but consecutive to the 90 days jail sentence.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 4 days were granted.

Concurrent with: any other sentence.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Herman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin J Herman in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court denies defendant's request to return to huber.
Review hearing on August 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Received June 28, 2016 from Elissa Herman, regarding refund of $1,250.00 bond.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin J Herman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1, repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1, repeater struck.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 4 days).  Commences immediately.  Concurrent to any other sentence.  
COSTS:  $343.00 
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
*** In lieu of paying the Costs and DNA the defendant is to serve 5 days huber, concurrent to any other case but consecutive to the 90 days.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin J Herman
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail,   (Effective: 04-07-2016)
Prior: C/O Waukesha Huber Facility,
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Justin J Herman in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin J Herman
Current: C/O Waukesha Huber Facility,   (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: W150 S7036 Cornell Circle, Muskego, WI 53150

Cases 16CM35 and 14CF53 called.  Defendant Justin J Herman in court with attorney James B. Duquette on case #14CF53 and attorney Eryn Menden on case #16CM35.  David Behn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Behm moves to lift the stay of the sentence or cashbail.  Attorney Duquette makes statements.  Attorney Menden makes statements. In case # 14CF53, Court order bail is to be revoked.  Defendant is to commence serving the 9 month condition time, to commence immediately.  Court will allow release for child care.   Attorney Menden moves for additional time in case # 16CM35.  Court takes off the 2/1 hearing date and adjourns that matter.  The future review hearing in Case #14CF53 is removed from the calendar.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to have any violent or harassing contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Justin J Herman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
